elements.brief: Recursively delete all instances flagged as bones ...

Recursively delete all instances flagged as bones under the given parent instance.

elements.description:
Description of a property.
If the property is externally mutable, m_ValuePtr points to the value and its length is m_ElementCount.
m_Variant always reflects the value.

members.doc: For composite properties (float arrays), these ids name each element
members.name: m_ElementIds

members.doc: Pointer to the value, only set for mutable values. The actual data type is described by the variant.
members.name: m_ValuePtr

members.doc: Determines whether we are permitted to write to this property.
members.name: m_ReadOnly

members.doc: Indicates type of the property (of type PropertyValueType).
members.name: m_ValueType

members.doc: Number of array entries, if the property is an array and zero otherwise. Max supported length is 2^14 (16384 elements)
members.name: m_ArrayLength

elements.name: PropertyDesc

elements.description: Parameters variant that holds key or index for a propertys data structure.

members.doc: The index of the property to set, only applicable if property is array.
members.name: m_Index

members.doc: The key of the property to set, only applicable if property is hashtable.
members.name: m_Key

members.doc: A flag if structure contain m_Key value (it can't contain both)
members.name: m_HasKey

elements.name: PropertyOptions

elements.description: Property result.
elements.name: PropertyResult

elements.description: Property types.

elements.description: Type of property value
elements.name: PropertyValueType

elements.name: PropertyVar

elements.brief: Set whether the instance should be flagged as a bo...
elements.description:
Set whether the instance should be flagged as a bone.
Instances flagged as bones can have their transforms updated in a batch through SetBoneTransforms.
Used for animated skeletons.

parameters.doc: true if the instance is a bone
parameters.name: bone

elements.brief: Set the local transforms recursively of all instan...

Set the local transforms recursively of all instances flagged as bones, starting with component with id.
The order of the transforms is depth-first.

parameters.doc: First Instance of the hierarchy to set

elements.brief: Gets the top node of the whole game (the main coll...
elements.description: Gets the top node of the whole game (the main collection)
elements.examples:
The following examples show how to iterate over currently loaded scene graph 
void OutputNode(dmGameObject::SceneNode* node) {
    dmGameObject::SceneNodeIterator it = dmGameObject::TraverseIterateChildren(node);
    while(dmGameObject::TraverseIterateNext(&it))
    {
        OutputProperties(&it.m_Node); // see dmGameObject::TraverseIterateProperties()
        OutputNode(&it.m_Node);
    }
}

bool OutputScene(HRegister regist) {
    dmGameObject::SceneNode root;
    if (!dmGameObject::TraverseGetRoot(regist, &root))
        return false;
    OutputNode(&node);
}
elements.name: TraverseGetRoot
notes: The dmGameObject::HRegister is obtained from the `dmEngine::GetGameObjectRegister(dmExtension::AppParams)`
Traversing the scene like this is not efficient. These functions are here for inspection and testing purposes only.

elements.name: TraverseIterateNext

returnvalues.doc: true if successful. false if the iterator is finished

elements.brief: Create a scene node traversal property iterator
elements.description: Create a scene node traversal property iterator
elements.examples:
The following examples show how to iterate over the properties of a node 
dmGameObject::SceneNodePropertyIterator pit = TraverseIterateProperties(node);
while(dmGameObject::TraverseIteratePropertiesNext(&pit))
{
    const char* name = dmHashReverseSafe64(pit.m_Property.m_NameHash);
    switch(pit.m_Property.m_Type)
    {
    case dmGameObject::SCENE_NODE_PROPERTY_TYPE_NUMBER: ...
    ...
    }
}
elements.name: TraverseIterateProperties
notes: Getting the properties like this is not efficient. These functions are here for inspection and testing purposes only.
Reverse hashes via `dmHashReverseSafe64()` isn't available in release builds.

elements.description: Steps the scene node traversal property iterator to the next property
elements.name: TraverseIteratePropertiesNext

returnvalues.doc: True if the iterator it valid, false if the iterator is finished.
returnvalues.name: finished
